tools.title: DTO Creation Guidelines [Java Quarkus]
tools.description: Comprehensive guidelines and best practices for creating Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) in Java Quarkus projects, including JSON property annotations, validation, and Lombok integration.

prompts.title: Create Java Quarkus DTO
prompts.description: Generate a Data Transfer Object (DTO) class for Java Quarkus following best practices including JsonProperty annotations, validation, and Lombok integration when available.

content.text:
Create a Java Quarkus DTO class that follows these requirements:

1. Always use @JsonProperty annotation for all fields
2. Include appropriate validation annotations (@NotNull, @NotBlank, @Email, etc.)
3. No domain/business logic - only data fields, validation, and simple utility methods
4. Can include utility methods like factory methods (create(), of()), conversion methods (toEntity(), fromEntity()), or builder pattern
5. If using Lombok: add @Getter, @Setter, @NoArgsConstructor, @AllArgsConstructor at class level
6. If not using Lombok: manually implement constructors, getters, and setters
7. Follow proper naming conventions (PascalCase for class, camelCase for fields)
8. Use proper package structure (com.company.project.dto)

Please specify:
- DTO class name
- Fields with their types
- Any specific validation requirements
- Whether the project uses Lombok or not
- Any utility methods needed (factory, conversion, etc.)
- Any specific JSON property naming conventions (snake_case, kebab-case, etc.)
